wiki.content: "Don't Let Me Be the Last to Know" is the fourth and last single from Britney Spears' second album Oops!...I Did It Again. The track was written by producer Robert John "Mutt" Lange and his then-wife, country artist Shania Twain. It was released on March 26, 2001, and was only moderately successful, failing to chart on either the Top 40 Tracks or Rhythmic Top 40 in the United States. Internationally, "Don't Let Me Be the Last to Know" fared better on the charts, peaking just outside the top ten (at #12) in the UK. The song is also notable for its video, directed by famed photographer Herb Ritts, which features Britney cuddling on a beach with French model Brice Durand. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.

Internationally, "Don't Let Me Be the Last to Know" fared better on the charts, peaking just outside the top ten (at #12) in the UK.

track.name: Don't Let Me Be the Last to Know
comments: Oh if you love me so... Don't let me be the............................. last to knOooOOoooOow yeaaah... Come on baby, come on darling. Oooh yeaah. Come on let me be the one. Come on noooow ♥
c'mon let me be the one, ooh <3
Essa música tem a cara da Shania Twain mesmo. ♥
